role.descr: entity created //transcription or translation or process//
specific location of tissue or cell //mostly saying about exon or intron//

example.text: Aggregation and secretion are believed to be initiated by platelet agonists by activating receptors coupled to the G-protein G(q), thereby raising cytosolic Ca(2+), [Ca(2+)](i).
example.arg: activating receptors coupled to the G-protein G(q)

example.text: Apparently HeLa cells have been either initiating transcription at multiple sites within RPS14 exon 1, or capping 5 oligonucleotides which were removed from most S14 mRNAs posttranscription.

Ligand binding induced cell surface receptor complex formation and activates a cascade of phosphorylation events of intracellular intermediaries termed Smads, which can initiate transcriptional regulation.

Ligand binding induces cell surface receptor complex formation and activates a cascade of phosphorylation events of intracellular intermediaries termed Smads that are observed to initiate transcriptional regulation.
Our data present a novel apical sorting pathway by which MV envelope glycoproteins are chaperoned by the M protein to be able to initiate virus release at that surface.
Polymerases that have the ability to initiate transcription with RSF can only extend their transcripts in the presence of FACT (facilitates chromatin transcription).
example.arg: in the presence of FACT (facilitates chromatin transcription)

example.text: SCF, like the other dimeric ligands, initates signal transduction by direct dimerization of its receptor, Kit, and the two juxtaposed receptors undergo tyrosine autophosphorylation (Heldin, 1995; Broudy, 1997), which is observed to initiate downstream intracellular signaling.

SCF, like the other dimeric ligands, initates signal transduction by direct dimerization of its receptor, Kit, and the two juxtaposed receptors undergo tyrosine autophosphorylation (Heldin, 1995; Broudy, 1997), which is observed to initiate downstream intracellular signaling.

SCF, like the other dimeric ligands, is able to initate signal transduction by direct dimerization of its receptor, Kit,and the two juxtaposed receptors undergo tyrosine autophosphorylation (Heldin, 1995; Broudy, 1997), which initiated downstream intracellular signaling.
example.arg: by direct dimerization of its receptor

example.text: Sxl was a key regulator of sex determination and dosage compensation, whose transcription can be initiated only in female blastoderm embryos.
Sxl was a key regulator of sex determination and dosage compensation, whose transcription may have been initiated only in female blastoderm embryos.
Sxl was a key regulator of sex determination and dosage compensation, whose transcription will be initiated only in female blastoderm embryos.
The repression may be initiated by autophosphorylation of the sensor protein ArcB, followed by phosphoryl group transfer to the regulator ArcA.
example.arg: autophosphorylation of the sensor protein ArcB

example.text: The repression may have been initiated by autophosphorylation of the sensor protein ArcB, followed by phosphoryl group transfer to the regulator ArcA.
example.arg: autophosphorylation of the sensor protein ArcB

example.text: Transcription of ptsG encoding glucose-specific permease, enzyme IICB (Glc), in Escherichia coli can be initiated from two promoters, P1 and P2.
example.arg: Transcription of ptsG encoding glucose-specific permease

example.text: Transcription will be initiated from a sigma (70)-dependent promoter at the G residue of the upstream GATC sequence.

Tumours with breakpoints just 5 to exon 1, or distant from c-myc, have normal c-myc mRNAs of 2.25 and 2.4 kb, which differ at their 5 ends, while tumours with breakpoints within exon 1 or intron 1 alter c-myc mRNAs (2.1-2.7 kb in Burkitt lines), which is able to be initiated within intron 1.

Tumours with breakpoints just 5 to exon 1, or distant from c-myc, have normal c-myc mRNAs of 2.25 and 2.4 kb, which differ at their 5 ends, while tumours with breakpoints within exon 1 or intron 1 alter c-myc mRNAs (2.1-2.7 kb in Burkitt lines), which will be initiated within intron 1.

Tumours with breakpoints just 5 to exon 1, or distant from c-myc, have normal c-myc mRNAs of 2.25 and 2.4 kb, which differ at their 5 ends, while tumours with breakpoints within exon 1 or intron 1 alter c-myc mRNAs that is able to be initiated within intron 1.

signal transduction is able to be initiated by SCF by direct dimerization of its receptor, Kit,and the two juxtaposed receptors undergo tyrosine autophosphorylation (Heldin, 1995; Broudy, 1997), which initiated downstream intracellular signaling.
example.arg: by direct dimerization of its receptor

example.arg: by direct dimerization of its receptor

example.text: I kappa B-epsilon translation has been initiated from an internal ATG codon at the G residue of the upstream GATC sequence.
I kappa B-epsilon translation will be initiated from an internal ATG codon at the G residue of the upstream GATC sequence.

example.text: RTKs have the ability to initiate signaling by recruiting downstream components to the activated receptor, thereby raising cytosolic Ca(2+), [Ca(2+)](i).

example.text: SCF, like the other dimeric ligands, initates signal transduction by direct dimerization of its receptor, Kit, and the two juxtaposed receptors undergo MV envelope glycoproteins (Heldin, 1995; Broudy, 1997), which has initiated virus release.

SCF, like the other dimeric ligands, initates signal transduction by direct dimerization of its receptor, Kit, and the two juxtaposed receptors undergo MV envelope glycoproteins chaperoned by the M protein (Heldin, 1995; Broudy, 1997), which initiated virus release.
example.arg: MV envelope glycoproteins chaperoned by the M protein

example.text: SCF, like the other dimeric ligands, initates signal transduction by direct dimerization of its receptor, Kit, and the two juxtaposed receptors undergo Polymerases (Heldin, 1995; Broudy, 1997), which is able to initiate transcription with RSF.

SCF, like the other dimeric ligands, initates signal transduction by direct dimerization of its receptor, Kit,and the two juxtaposed receptors undergo SCF (Heldin, 1995; Broudy, 1997), which initiates signal transduction.

Since Platelet agonists initiate aggregation and secretion by activating receptors coupled to the G-protein G(q), proteins that are immediately downstream of an activated RTK can be identified by first identifying sequences in the RTK that are necessary to activate downstream signaling (Schlessinger and Ullrich, 1992; Pawson, 1995).
example.arg: activating receptors coupled to the G-protein G(q)

example.text: Since signal transduction can be initiated by SCF by by direct dimerization of its receptor, proteins that are immediately downstream of an activated RTK can be identified by first identifying sequences in the RTK that are necessary to activate downstream signaling (Schlessinger and Ullrich, 1992; Pawson, 1995).
example.arg: by direct dimerization of its receptor

example.text: Since signal transduction may be initiated by SCF by by direct dimerization of its receptor, proteins that are immediately downstream of an activated RTK can be identified by first identifying sequences in the RTK that are necessary to activate downstream signaling (Schlessinger and Ullrich, 1992; Pawson, 1995).
example.arg: by direct dimerization of its receptor

example.text: Transcription initiated from a sigma (70)-dependent promoter gives rise to a protein of 45 kDa, which existed as multiple phosphorylated isoforms in resting cells.
